step.description: starting step: mapping, markduplicates, prepare_recalibration, recalibrate, variant_calling, annotate

wes.description: Enable when exome or panel data is provided: true, false

tools.description: Tools to use for duplicate marking, variant calling and/or for annotation.

fasta.description: S3 Path to FASTA genome file.

aligner.description: Specify aligner to be used to map reads to reference genome.: bwa-mem, bwa-mem2, dragmap, sention-bwamem

save_output_as_bam.description: Saves output from mapping (if --save_mapped), Markduplicates & Baserecalibration as BAM file instead of CRAM: true, false

trim_fastq.description: Run FastP for read trimming: true, false

split_fastq.description: Specify how many reads each split of a FastQ file contains. Set 0 to turn off splitting at all. default 5000000

intervals.description: Path to target bed file in case of whole exome or targeted sequencing or intervals file.

no_intervals.description: Disable usage of intervals: true, false

use_gatk_spark.description: Enable usage of GATK Spark implementation for duplicate marking and/or base quality score recalibration

joint_germline.description: Turn on the joint germline variant calling for GATK haplotypecaller

joint_mutect2.description: Runs Mutect2 in joint (multi-sample) mode for better concordance among variant calls of tumor samples from the same patient. Only a single normal sample per patient is allowed. Tumor-only mode is also supported.
